channel.title: homebrew on Home
channel.description: Recent content in homebrew on Home

item.title: Gobo / Homebrew and Linux Application Organization
item.description: Introduction I really liked the way Gobo Linux re-factored the organization of a linux filesystem. The short story of Gobo was to have each Recipe (application/library) install everything it needs into its own directory. The app files are then linked to support the legacy filesystem that the OS needs (You can read more at Gobo at Glance or the history of gobo linux).
